content.description: Start in an awkward crack in the gully, gear to first bolt or maybe stick clip? then pull onto face and continue up line o bolts. Follow left arete on both pitches. Quite a bit o lichen.

climbs.name: No Climb for Old Men
climbs.fa: Pitch 1: Chris Barnes 2010  Pitch 2:  Chris Barnes and Mike Engle

content.description:
A tough couple moves off the ground and some getting to the last bolt. Might want to stick clip the second bolt because the first won't be enough to keep you off the slab below.

There is a second pitch that works it way up and right then finishes on the right side of a prominent pillar, 5.7. Not particularly great second pitch except the view might make it worth it.
content.protection: 8-ish bolts to bolted anchors of the first pitch.  Chain anchors at the top of the second pitch allows you to get down to the first pitch anchors on "No Climb for Old Men"
content.location: Just left of the small chimney, this route goes up a face.

content.description: Start in little groove fifteen feet right of the climb on the right side of the gully (that's North Face 10d). Crux is right is in your face through the second bolt, head to fun climbing and a little roof above.
Continuously challenging throughout, this very nice route has a technical crux midway to a large ledge.  From here, a tenuous balancy move up and right leads to the anchor.
content.location: Right side of the North Wall.  It's the first bolted route left of the crack line, Absence of Authority.

content.description:
This arete route has a lot of enjoyable moves and a good position but is somewhat contrived in a couple spots. The start can be skipped by scrambling up some boulders to the right and stepping onto the route above the first bolt, and the crux (just below the roof/right-veering crack) can be by-passed by following the chalked holds left a few feet to the crack and then heading back up and right.  Avoiding the crux makes the route around

10b.
content.protection: Bolts with rap anchors at the top.
content.location: Far right corner of the North Wall, on the arete.  Just around the arete corner is The Crack House.

content.description:
This route starts with a somewhat dirty but fun 5.9+ dihedral. After about 70' you reach a small roof where the real challenges start.  Protect well before leaving the crack and launching up into devious thin face moves (crux) leading to a seam that protects only with very small gear (ie. RPs, etc).  Finish by veering right on a horizontal crack that leads to the top anchors of Hairstyles and Attitudes.

Note:  The start of the route has vegetation in the crack that can be climbed around.  Please don't remove any more vegetation at the start of this climb.
content.protection: Gear to 2 1/2" and small wires/gear (RPs, Lowe Balls...)
content.location: Just left of Hairstyle and Attitudes and left around the corner from the Crack House.  This is the crack line at the far right side of the wall.
